Events that occurred on 16 November.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1917 – J.R.R. Tolkien's first son, John, is born.
1917 – J.R.R. Tolkien attends a medical board examination. He requires further indoor hospital treatment. His address is given as 9th Royal Defence Corps, Withernsea.
1969 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 312.
1971 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Miss Fay Darrington.
1997 - The Brazilian Tolkien Society is founded.
2011 - The Lord of the Rings: War in the North is released in Australia and New Zealand.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
F.A. 495:
Tuor, guided by Voronwë, travels to Gondolin in order to deliver Ulmo's message to Turgon.
T.A. 3018:
Frodo and Samwise rest in Rivendell and prepare for their quest to destroy the One Ring.
